title: Linux systemctl Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the systemctl command, a powerful tool for managing system services in Linux. Learn how to start, stop, enable, and disable services, as well as configure automatic service startup.

meta.title: Linux systemctl Command with Practical Examples

meta.keywords: systemctl, Linux, system services, service management, service configuration, service startup, system administration
